member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason
member.summary: Lists potential reasons why an outgoing connection could not be established.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason.Unreachable
member.summary: The remote peer did not accept the connection. This might mean the client has gone offline or the client is behind a NAT/Firewall and cannot accept incoming connections.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason.EncryptionNegiotiationFailed
member.summary: After accepting the connection, a compatible connection encryption method could not be selected. Alternatively the remote peer could have reached it's open connection limit and simply closed the connection, or it could mean the peer did not support encrypted connections.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason.HandshakeFailed
member.summary: A compatible connection encryption method was selected, but the peer closed the connection after the normal handshake was sent. This could mean the remote peer reached it's open connection limit and simply closed the connection, or it could mean the peer did not actually support the chosen encryption. This can happen if we choose to create an unencrypted outgoing connection and the peer only supports encrypted connections.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.ConnectionFailureReason.Unknown
member.summary: There is no clear reason why the connection attempt failed.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.Client.PeerId.GetDownloadRate
member.summary:
Get our download rate from this peer -- this is Dp.
1. If we are not choked by this peer, return the actual measure download rate. 2. If we are choked, then attempt to make an educated guess at the download rate using the following steps - use the rate of Have messages received from this peer as an estimate of its download rate - assume that its upload rate is equivalent to its estimated download rate - divide this upload rate by the standard implementation's active set size for that rate

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings
member.summary: Represents the Settings which need to be passed to the engine

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.AllowedEncryption
member.summary: A prioritised list of encryption methods, including plain text, which can be used to connect to another peer. Connections will be attempted in the same order as they are in the list. Defaults to , which is , and .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.AllowHaveSuppression
member.summary: Have suppression reduces the number of Have messages being sent by only sending Have messages to peers which do not already have that piece. A peer will never request a piece they have already downloaded, so informing them that we have that piece is not beneficial. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.AllowLocalPeerDiscovery
member.summary: True if the engine should use LocalPeerDiscovery to search for local peers. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.AllowPortForwarding
member.summary: True if the engine should automatically forward ports using any compatible UPnP or NAT-PMP device. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.AutoSaveLoadDhtCache
member.summary: If set to true dht nodes will be implicitly saved when there are no active instances in the engine. Dht nodes will be restored when the first is started. Otherwise dht nodes will not be cached between restarts and the will have to bootstrap from scratch each time. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.AutoSaveLoadFastResume
member.summary: If set to true FastResume data will be implicitly saved after is invoked, and will be implicitly loaded before the is returned by Otherwise fast resume data will not be saved or restored and instances will have to perform a full hash check when they start. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.AutoSaveLoadMagnetLinkMetadata
member.summary: This setting affects torrents downloaded using a . When enabled, metadata for the torrent will be loaded from , if it exists, when the is added to the engine using . Additionally, metadata will be written to this directory if it is successfully retrieved from peers so future downloads can start immediately. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.CacheDirectory
member.summary: The full path to the directory used to cache any data needed by the engine. Typically used to store a cache of the DHT table to improve bootstrapping speed, any metadata downloaded using a magnet link, or fast resume data for individual torrents. Defaults to a sub-directory of called 'cache'

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: If a connection attempt does not complete within the given timeout, it will be cancelled so a connection can be attempted with a new peer. Defaults to 10 seconds. It is highly recommended to keep this value within a range of 7-15 seconds unless absolutely necessary.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.DiskCacheBytes
member.summary: Creates a cache which buffers data before it's written to the disk, or after it's been read from disk. Set to 0 to disable the cache. Defaults to 5MB.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.DiskCachePolicy
member.summary: Creates a cache which buffers data before it's written to the disk, or after it's been read from disk. Set to 0 to disable the cache. Defaults to 5MB.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.DhtEndPoint
member.summary: The UDP port used for DHT communications. Set the port to 0 to choose a random available port. Set to null to disable DHT. Defaults to IPAddress.Any with port 0.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.FastResumeCacheDirectory
member.summary: This is the full path to a sub-directory of . If is enabled then fast resume data will be written to this when or is invoked. If fast resume data is available, the data will be loaded from disk as part of or . If is invoked, any on-disk fast resume data will be deleted to eliminate the possibility of loading stale data later.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.FastResumeMode
member.summary: When is true, this setting is used to control how fast resume data is maintained, otherwise it has no effect. You can prioritise accuracy (at the risk of requiring full hash checks if an actively downloading torrent does not cleanly enter the state) by choosing . You can prioritise torrent start speed (at the risk of re-downloading a small amount of data) by choosing , in which case a recent, not not 100% accurate, copy of the fast resume data will be loaded whenever it is available. if an actively downloading Torrent does not cleanly enter the state. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.HttpStreamingPrefix
member.summary: The list of HTTP(s) endpoints which the engine should bind to when a is set up to stream data from the torrent and is non-null. Should be of the form "http://ip-address-or-hostname:port". Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:5555'.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.ListenEndPoints
member.summary: The TCP port the engine should listen on for incoming connections. Set the port to 0 to use a random available port, set to null to disable incoming connections. Defaults to IPAddress.Any and IPAddress.AnyIPv6, both with port 0.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MaximumConnections
member.summary: The maximum number of concurrent open connections overall. Defaults to 150.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MaximumDownloadRate
member.summary: The maximum download rate, in bytes per second, overall. A value of 0 means unlimited. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MaximumHalfOpenConnections
member.summary: The maximum number of concurrent connection attempts overall. Defaults to 8.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MaximumUploadRate
member.summary: The maximum upload rate, in bytes per second, overall. A value of 0 means unlimited. defaults to 0.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MaximumOpenFiles
member.summary: The maximum number of files which can be opened concurrently. On platforms which limit the maximum filehandles for a process it can be beneficial to limit the number of open files to prevent running out of resources. A value of 0 means unlimited, but this is not recommended. Defaults to 196.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MaximumDiskReadRate
member.summary: The maximum disk read rate, in bytes per second. A value of 0 means unlimited. This is typically only useful for non-SSD drives to prevent the hashing process from saturating the available drive bandwidth. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MaximumDiskWriteRate
member.summary: The maximum disk write rate, in bytes per second. A value of 0 means unlimited. This is typically only useful for non-SSD drives to prevent the downloading process from saturating the available drive bandwidth. If the download rate exceeds the max write rate then the download will be throttled. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.ReportedListenEndPoints
member.summary: If the IPAddress incoming peer connections are received on differs from the IPAddress the tracker Announce or Scrape requests are sent from, specify it here. Typically this should not be set. Defaults to

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.StaleRequestTimeout
member.summary: When blocks have been requested from a peer, the connection to that peer will be closed and the requests will be cancelled if it takes longer than this time to receive a 16kB block. This value must be higher than or the web seeds will be considered unhealthy before their connection timeout is exceeded. Defaults to 40 seconds.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.MetadataCacheDirectory
member.summary: This is the full path to a sub-directory of . If a magnet link is used to download a torrent, the downloaded metata will be cached here.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.UsePartialFiles
member.summary: If set to then partially downloaded files will have ".!mt" appended to their filename. When the file is fully downloaded, the ".!mt" suffix will be removed. Defaults to as this is a pre-release feature.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.WebSeedConnectionTimeout
member.summary: The timeout used when connecting to a WebSeed's HTTP endpoint. Defaults to 30 seconds.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.WebSeedDelay
member.summary: The delay before a torrent will start using web seeds. Defaults to 1 minute.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.EngineSettings.WebSeedSpeedTrigger
member.summary: The download speed under which a torrent will start using web seeds. Defaults to 15kB/sec.

member.summary: The delay before a torrent will start using web seeds. A value of zero means 'immediately'. Using webseeds by default is not recommended

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.FastResumeMode.Accurate
member.summary: When is enabled the engine will delete fast resume data from disk when the enters the state, or if the hash check is cancelled. FastResume data will be written to disk when the enters mode, or when the torrent enters the state and no errors occurred. If a crash occurs, a full hash check will be performed the next time the torrent is started, meaning there is no chance duplicate data will be downloaded.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Client.FastResumeMode.BestEffort
member.summary: When is enabled the engine will not delete fast resume data from disk when the enters the state. In this mode the engine will write an updated copy of the fast resume data on a regular cadence. In the event of a crash, the most recent fast resume data will be loaded from disk and a full hash check will not be performed. This may result in a small amount of data being redownloaded.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentSettings.RequirePeerIdToMatch
member.summary: The BitTorrent specification requires that clients which initiate an outgoing connection to a remote peer must close that connection if the remote peer reports a different 'peer_id' than it previously reported to the tracker. Several prominant BitTorrent clients/libraries, such as libtorrent, randomise their peer id. Additionally, if the announce request requests a compact response, the peer id will not be known anyway. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentSettings.UploadSlots
member.summary: The number of peers which can be uploaded to concurrently for this torrent. A value of 0 means unlimited. defaults to 8.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentSettings.ConnectionRetentionFactor
member.summary: When considering peers that have given us data, the inactivity manager will wait TimeToWaiTUntilIdle plus (Number of bytes we've been sent / ConnectionRetentionFactor) seconds before they are eligible for disconnection. Default value is 2000. A value of 0 prevents the inactivity manager from disconnecting peers that have sent data.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentSettings.MaximumPeerDetails
member.summary: The number of peers we should maintain in our internal lists. If we are allowed maintain 100 connections, we will store 150 peer ip/port combos in memory. This should ensure we hit our maximum allowed connections.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Client.TorrentSettings.TimeToWaitUntilIdle
member.summary: The time, in seconds, the inactivity manager should wait until it can consider a peer eligible for disconnection. Peers are disconnected only if they have not provided any data. Default is 600. A value of 0 disables the inactivity manager.
